boardgame.name: Card Battlers RPG
boardgame.description: Card Battlers RPG is a printable solo RPG in which the player takes the role of a trainer who has entered a mystical tournament wherein creatures summoned from cards do battle. It is played with the rules/character sheet, a pencil, a coin, and a deck of poker cards.

boardgame.name: 1877: Stockholm Tramways
boardgame.description:
In 1872 Stockholm Tramway Company was founded with the ambition of constructing tramways in Stockholm. Having failed to do so the company was dissolved in 1874 only to be founded again two years later under the new name Stockholm New Tramway Company. The new company was successful and on July 10, 1877, the first horse-drawn carriage traversed the streets of Stockholm. The tramway era had begun.

1877: Stockholm Tramways is a game in the 18xx series set in Stockholm. The players are investors in tramway companies during the late 19th century and the first half of the 20th century (1877 - 1966). In contrast to other games in the 18xx series, 1877 allows players to perform hostile takeovers under certain circumstances.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Bird of the Year
boardgame.description:
Each year in New Zealand there is a competition to vote for the most popular bird - this is to help raise awareness for some of the worlds most endangered wildlife, their habitats and threats they face. What if that competition wasn't about who got the most votes, but which bird was the best in a variety of challenges and scenarios?

Bird of the Year is a 9 card game that puts various New Zealand birds against each other to win the prestigious title of 'Bird of the Year'. Can your bird win and be crowned the champion for this year?

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Free Radicals: GeekyGameyGadgets Insert/Organizer
boardgame.description:
Laser cut organizer for your copy of Free Radicals.

This custom wood insert holds all the pieces for Free Radicals. Game setup is far faster because players receive a tray that matches their chosen color. They'll use the cubes and all the player pieces on the left or right side of those cubes, depending on which side of the player mat they chose. No more sorting needed!

All trays include customized engravings depicting their contents, so it's easy to see what goes where. Allows game to be stored however you want: horizontally or vertically. Supports sleeved or unsleeved cards

Arrives with all pieces punched out and ready for assembly. Does not include the game itself. Includes instructions and plenty of email support so you won't worry about encountering any issues.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Free Radicals

boardgame.name: Wars of Religion, France 1562-1598
boardgame.description:
From 1563 to 1598, a civil war raged across the kingdom of France, involving all neighbouring countries. It pitted the last kings of the Valois line, the Protestants Huguenots and the Ultracatholics League. Part diplomacy game, part wargame, The Wars of Religion let you remake history.

Each turn, you will use your supporters at court to improve your position in the kingdom. Then you will try to solve the struggle on the battlefield. You have six turns to prove that God is on your side.

Remember, «Paris vaut bien une messe !»

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: B17: The Fight for Air Supremacy
boardgame.description: B17 The Fight for Air Supremacy is a solitaire roll and write war game. The player takes control of a B17 bomber and its crew, the B17 must reach its target and get back home without taking too much damage and trying to keep the crew intact. The player will face many challenges in the form of German fighters, flak and mechanical problems. Can you keep your nerve and take to the skies and help to reduce German fighter production.

boardgame.name: Match Ball: The Game After the Match
boardgame.description:
Card game simulating the exciting back and forth of a tennis match. Scoring is similar to real tennis, complete with aces and smashes.

Game play requires strategic timing of countering your opponent’s cards. Each card has a level of hierarchy, and choosing the right moment to play or keep each card in your hand presents a new challenge every turn.

First player to win best of three sets (like in the physical sport of tennis), wins the game and receives a trophy card for each set won.

Great family game for any tennis player or fan of the sport. It helps to know actual tennis scoring before starting a game, but can be picked up easily by anyone after a few tries - and can even help teach the sport itself.

boardgame.name: Bonaparte in the Quadrilateral
boardgame.description:
May 1796 – Having crushed Piedmont in a lightening campaign the young revolutionary General Bonaparte prepared to attack the key Austrian fortress of Mantova, the only one of the four fortress of the quadrilateral still in Austrian control. Little did he know that it would take nine months of desperate fighting before the fortress fell.

Lodi, 10 May; The Force of Destiny –A desperate battle to cross the bridge across the Po and continue the pursuit of the Austrian forces.

Castiglione, 5 August; Wurmser’s Relief of Mantova - A veteran Austria army prepares to sweep away the French gains of the last few months.

Mantova, Queen of the Quadrilateral, 1796-97 – Three Austrian attempts to relive the siege of this key city.

Arcole, 15-17 November; Crossing the Adige — A French attempt to outflank the Austrians runs in to trouble.

Rivoli, 14-15 January; Battle of the Osteria Gorge – The final Austrian relief effort is being stopped by Joubert, when Austrian reinforcements cut off the French. Bonaparte must act to relive the and defeat the Austrians.

The Library of Napoleonic Battles TLNB-series, evolved from the very successful Napoleon´s Last Battles, combining a high level of historical detail and beautiful and accurate maps with excellent playability, is covering, at Brigade level, (almost) every major Napoleonic battle.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: The Library of Napoleonic Battles (OSG)

boardgame.name: Astralis
boardgame.description:
Astralis is an abstract, space odyssey, area-control strategy game for two players, played on a hex-hex 8 gameboard. Each player starts with one colony ship pawn and 30 planets stones. Players share 169 double-sided control tiles and 60 contested tiles.

On a turn, a player must move his or her ship pawn one or more hexes, in any one of the six standard directions, to any hex not containing any stone or the opponent's pawn. Pawns may pass over any hexes not containing an opponent's stone or pawn. Pawns can pass over owned stones. Control tiles never impede movement and simply indicate ownership of a hex.

When a pawn reaches its destination hex, the player may place a control tile and an owned stone on top in any one of the empty hexes adjacent to the pawn that is not adjacent to any other stone.

For each hex adjacent to a placed stone, if the hex is not adjacent to any opponent stone, place a control tile own-side up in the hex; and if the hex has one or more adjacent opponent stones, replace the opponent’s control tile with a contested tile.

The game ends when all hexes contain a control or contested tile. To determine the winner, players count the number of control tiles they have on the board. The second player adds a komi of 3.5 points to his total. The player with the highest total wins.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Dr. Strange & the Electrified Robot Tao
boardgame.description:
Publisher Description

"Greetings, mister secret agent. We meet again."

You are once again poised to foil the plans of the evil mad scientist, Dr. Strange, who is once again bent on world domination. You have tracked the evil Doctor to his lair. You just have to make it through the 50 foyers of guards and robots to defeat the Doctor and his minions. But proceed with caution - the Doctor has filled each foyer with electrified barriers!

"Guards! After him!"

The guards are actually the least of your problems. After a quick punch (or even just bumping into them) they will go running willy nilly into an electric pole or wall - just be careful because an errant guard might run into a spot that obstructs your path to victory.

"Electrified robots - attack!"

As you proceed deeper into the lair, you will encounter the most devious creation yet devised by Dr. Strange - his electrified robots. While they are deadly if you run into them, they are not always as dangerous as they sound. Having originated as prototype robot vacuums, their programming is somewhat predictable and bumbling. Your key to making it through all fifty foyers is to master the Electrified Robot Tao.

"Try as you might, secret agent man, you cannot defeat me."

Stalk the guards, evade the robots, complete the foyers, and DEFEAT DR. STRANGE once and for all.

User Summary

A BASIC language action-oriented TRS-80 game with light puzzle elements. Although inspired by the core gameplay of a 1983 "edutainment" game, Wunder, Dr. Strange & the Electrified Robot Tao is brand new for 2022. As a BASIC game, it can be typed into a physical TRS-80, or the program file (ERT/BAS) can be directly loaded into a TRS-80 emulator.

A note regarding Dr. Strange: Beyond sharing a common name, there is no relation between this game's titular character and the Marvel sorcerer character.

boardgame.name: Tiny Combat Arena
boardgame.description:
Tiny Combat Arena is an approachable flight combat simulator sporting a stylized look and various game modes. Dogfight your way in the arena and in quick action or craft your own scenarios and take part in a vast war with objectives and friendly armies to support.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Circus
boardgame.description:
Circus is a board game, a family filler in which you will have to find out the secret combination of circus characters. To do this you will have the help of a blackboard where you can write down everything that happens during the game.

At the beginning of the game and randomly 5 character tokens will be placed face down on the board. Taking turns, all the people will roll the die, the number they get will be the number of tokens they will be able to flip over. That will be the first information they will have. The rest they will have to find out during the course of the game.

To facilitate the work there are the character cards that have their own abilities.

Track boss: you can move a card from the playing area to the discard deck.
Clown: you can swap the position of two character cards on the board.
Bullet woman: everyone must quickly put his hand on this card, the last one to do so must uncover a card from his playing area.
Trapeze artist: swap a card from your hand with a card from an opponent's hand.
Juggler: choose who must lose the next turn.
Magician: secretly uncover as many character cards on the board as the result of the die.
Audience: use this card to defend yourself from the effects of the trapeze artist, juggler, or ringmaster.


To win, you must not only find out the combination of characters on the board, but you must also have in your playing area the combination formed by the cards that you have had to keep during the game.

The following actions are available each turn:

Draw a card from the central deck and raise it to your hand.
Use a card from your hand and execute one of these actions:
Lower it face down to your playing area
Turn the card



The winner is the one who manages to find out the combination of characters on the board and has the generated combination in his playing area. To end the game, the person who thinks he has the winning combination must play a Carp card.

boardgame.name: 1562: The beginning of a tragedy
boardgame.description:
1562 : the beginning of a tragedy is a grand tactical game which, for the first time, allows the simulation of three battles of that era:

DREUX, 19th December 1562 : the very first important battle.
VERGT (VER as known at this era), 9th October 1562 : won by the very famous catholic general Blaise de Montluc.
LE BESSAT, 31st October 1562 ; an intro scenario with few counters for discovering the rules.


1562 : the beginning of a tragedy is the Volume III of the series By Shot, Shock and Faith (in French: "Par le feu, le fer et la foi") allows the simulation of religious wars that occurred in France from 1562 to 1598. This civil war opposes, in a first conflict phase, protestants- otherwise known as Huguenots- to catholics, then royalists to League members after the accession of Henri IV to the throne in 1589. The art of war during this period of the Renaissance is rapidly changing. The great feudal landlords, steeped in morals, fight alongside mercenaries motivated by sole cupidity. The diversity of the weapons that are used offers great tactical possibilities, based on impact and fire. Gendarmes, cuirassiers, reiters, harquebusiers, lansquenets and Swiss mercenaries confront each other in a merciless fight.

This is a classic game system ; « I go, You go », of average complexity, including, during the active player's phase, a sequence of reaction from the passive player, such as fire, counter-charge or tactical backstep. The maps are with areas from 300 to 500 m by side. A color code allows to easily determine the costs of movements and the line of sight. The scale of the game is one unit for 100 to 500 soldiers or one or two guns. One game turn represents a duration of 20 to 30 minutes. A corps represents either a vanguard or a rearguard, or the main body called battle.

The combats allow to simulate charges « in wall », the merciless shocks between pikemen, the artillery fire and highlight, by a support system, the combination of iron -shock- and fire -shooting. The optional rules- caracoles, orders, lost children, looting- add even more realism to the era's battles. The rules and the three battles offered are based on a thorough bibliography and researches made into books written by contemporary authors, specifically François de la Noue for the Protestants and Blaise de Montluc for the Catholics, and also on precise topographical plans of each battlefield that is still accessible... Are you ready to put on the Henri de Guise, Prince de Condé and fight your enemies ?

—description from the designer
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: The Fate of Reiters: Five Battles of the French Wars of Religion
Par le feu, le fer et la Foi

boardgame.name: Battle Shards
boardgame.description:
Be the player with the most Shards (cards) in your Shard Pile (cards you won) to win! To win Shards, have the highest attack.

Your attack depends on the color of your solid block (red, yellow or blue), against the number that matches your opponent's square for that color (1, 2 or 3).

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Freelance Traveller (Issue 110 - Mar/Apr 2022)
boardgame.description:
From the contents page

Freelance Traveller #110: March/April 2022

Freelance Traveller is published bimonthly in PDF form by the editor. The current issue (and all back issues) can be found on Freelance Traveller’s website, http://www.freelancetraveller.com.
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: Doing It My Way: Mini-Game for Computer Hacking
Kurishdam: Jump Destination: Khorlu, Bronson's Star
Multimedia Gallery: Pirates of Drinax: Hunting Pirates
The Prep Room: Above the Crowd
The Prep Room: Jottings #13: Calendars II: Naming
Raconteurs' Rest: The Old Scout: Light in the Darkness

boardgame.name: Whatzit?
boardgame.description:
It's the Game of Batty Wordplay!

Solve rebuses to score the most number of points by solving cards.

Whatzit?s are cleverly crafted puzzles that challenge you to find a familiar phrase, name, or saying in a unique arrangement of letters, symbols, numbers, or pictures.

After filling the card holder/spinner, spin the tray to see who will start the first round. Start the timer, and that person tries to solve as many cards before time runs out. If there are still cards left, the player to the left attempts to clear the tray before times run out. Play continues to the left until the tray is empty.

boardgame.name: Forge
boardgame.description:
Forge is a worker-placement strategy game in which players take on the role of Master Blacksmiths operating and developing great Forges in medieval Europe.

Players begin the game with a basic blacksmith’s shop, full of all of the tools they need to forge the most basic of items. Players send forth their Assistants, and their Master Blacksmith, to complete tasks in and out of the city to acquire the resources needed to develop their forge and fulfill contracts. Players will work towards completing different achievements, while also acquiring victory points, as the game progresses.

Players are trying to earn the most Victory Points through a series of different methods. The game ends when one player has accomplished 5 different achievements. The current round will be completed, and then final scoring will take place.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Worst-Case Scenario Card Game
boardgame.description:
How do you compare living through a pandemic to being chased by a gorilla or locked in the trunk of a moving car or losing your memory or being lost at sea? We live in a dangerous world, and now is the time for you to decide which scenarios are bad, very bad, awful, horrible, or simply the worst!

Take turns playing "The Victim" and score points when your fellow players match how you rank five worst-case scenarios. The Victim's Wheel decides your fate on every turn, but when disaster strikes... all that matters is who thinks alike!

boardgame.name: État d'urgence
boardgame.description:
Manage a global epidemic without any skills, while maintaining the trust of the people! In this battle deck with simple and effective rules, you will try to unravel the complicated threads of a planetary virus. Try to be the last one the French still trust!

Embody the government, the scientific council, the laboratories or the media and make the right choices to maintain the trust of the people and destroy that of your opponents.

At your turn, attack your opponents or buy cards that will allow you to make stronger attacks or buy even stronger cards.
A player loses the game when the people no longer trust them.

boardgame.name: Surviving Singapore
boardgame.description:
Life in Singapore is full of obstacles. Can you survive?

Surviving Singapore is a strategy card game where players attempt to overcome obstacles, and be the first to reach the level 8 to win the game. From running out of toilet paper, losing your IC, to being in the same room as a cockroach that can fly.


Overcome obstacles: Face obstacles and beat them to gain a level
Sabo your friends: Slow down the competition and hinder their progress
Reach the top: Be the first to climb your way up to level 8


Can you survive all the obstacles that SG can throw at you?

boardgame.name: Game of United States History
boardgame.description:
Game of United States History is designed for play by 3-10 persons. It contains 56 cards in which seven historical divisions are included:

Commerce and Industry
Education and Religion
Finance
Invention
Territorial Expansion
Transportation
War


Each of these divisions treats two or more subjects/events/movements, with two cards giving specifics regarding the subject/event/movement. Of the two cards, the first treats the beginning or early phase of the movement; the second details the results of the event or the evolution of the movement. The two cards constitute a "pair". In matching the cards of a pair, the same illustrations occur on each card of the pair.

The instructions include directions for five different variations that may be played with this game.

—user summary
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Card Game of United States History

boardgame.name: Riverbed Hunt
boardgame.description:
Imitating humans in constructing houses and large ships, tritons quickly became a trading folk, and their agricultural villages flourished on the riverbank of Ie.
Triton merchants are known for being able to provide extremely rare goods, such as dried starlight kelp seeds from Ie’s riverbed. Humans are willing to pay great sums for them, giving the triton merchants the incentive to seek them out, extract and provide to the market.
A group of tritons, which the governing order calls “Separatists”, dissatisfied with the commercial policy of their fellow citizens, began protesting, sabotaging the merchants’ trade of the sacred to them, kelp seed. Of course, there are those who seek to take advantage of the whole situation and, in secrecy, exploit both sides for their own benefit...

Riverbed Hunt is a light strategy deduction board game for 4 to 9 players.
Randomly take the role of a Merchant, Separatist, or the Profiteer.
This secret role will define your gameplay.
During your turn, perform one of your three available actions.
Dive to explore river tiles.
Swim to move around the river board.
Coop or Uncover to reveal river tiles.
In addition, you may play an ability card from your hand, to enhance your strategies.
Bring items to the surface until one of the win conditions is met.
Reveal enough Kelps and the Merchants succeed in growing their trading business with the humans.
Reveal enough Logs and the Separatists succeed in blocking this trade!
If enough Coins are revealed, the Profiteer managed to deceive everyone about his intentions, for his own profit!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Rise TCG
boardgame.description:
Rise is a unique trading card game set in a fantasy multiverse infused with powers and magic.

Rise is a card game based on deck construction, strategy, inertia and luck.
You can play it alone (dungeon mode) or in duel, and especially in multiplayer.
Evolve your summoners and unleash your power to be the only player to have at least 1 of his summoners still alive.

The first season contains 306 different carefully designed and illustrated cards.

Rise is much more than these few lines, to really know and discover the game, with its possibilities, its gameplay and its depth, I invite you to discover all the informations on the wiki page of the project: rules of the game, the complete list of cards, the history and much more!

boardgame.name: Audimat
boardgame.description:
Choose one of four location (yacht, loft, villa, deserted island).
Each player chooses one of eight clothing and accessory card.

The show is about to start.
You play as TV show contestants, in a Big Brother style show:
The Production manages everything, you can't leave the set and cameras are rolling day and night.

Read the few rule cards: Big Brother is setting up the boundaries.
Then take turn reading and answering question cards. This is Big Brother summoning you in isolation to answer private questions.
The story will grow, one card, one answer at a time. Before you know it, an exciting story will unfold, filled with plots, backstories, partnership and betrayals.

You'll need to vote your rivals out but beware: the eliminated contestants still participate in votes (representing the viewers' vote).
Can you be the last one standing?

boardgame.name: iGranie z Gruzem: Nędzność i Biedność
boardgame.description:
Just when you think that life can't get any worse, it always surprises you with something terrible. The same with iGaming with Rubble! You thought it couldn't get any worse? Yes, it can!

Nędzność i Biedność ("Misery and Poverty") is an unbelievable addition to the game. 55 new cards will make your character's life even more miserable, every trip to work an ordeal, and breathing a sigh of relief at the thought of chilling - a challenge to fate.

description from the publisher (translated)

Kiedy myślisz, że w życiu nie może spotkać Cię już nic gorszego, ono zawsze zaskakuje czymś okropnym. Podobnie w iGraniu z Gruzem! Wydawało Wam się, że gorzej już być nie może? Może!

iGranie z Gruzem: Nędzność i Biedność to niesamodzielny dodatek do gry. 55 nowych kart sprawi, że życie postaci będzie jeszcze większą męczarnią, każde wyjście do pracy stanie się drogą przez mękę, a odetchnięcie z ulgą na myśl o chilloucie - rzuceniem wyzwania losowi.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Tome of Champions 2021
boardgame.description:
The Tome of Champions 2021 is an essential companion to Warcry, no matter how you like to play. From new narrative content to twists for matched play and fresh open play game modes, it’s packed with updated rules and ideas to inspire you. Incredible new adventures in the Eightpoints await.

Inside, you'll find:

A Rules Update for 2021, including the introduction of Grand Alliances in Warcry
Updated points values for Warcry fighter cards to better reflect their power in battle
Open play rules for fighting sieges between two teams of players
Narrative play rules for branching quests where players get to choose their path through the adventure
New fated quests for warbands from each of the four Grand Alliances
Six narrative campaigns that offer a new dynamic challenge to players
Pitched battles battleplans for the new Warcry season and a detailed tournament pack, making running your own even easier than ever before
New hidden agendas that can be used as secondary objectives in tournaments
Rules for using the Lumineth Realm-lords, Soulblight Gravelords, Kruleboyz orruks, and Thunderstrike Stormcast Eternals in Warcry
Rules for using Warhammer Underworlds warbands from Shadespire, Nightvault, Beastgrave, and Direchasm in your games of Warcry


—description from the publisher

Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Catacombs
Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Red Harvest

boardgame.name: SAS: Rogue Regiment
boardgame.description:
Raise merry hell with the legendary operators of the Special Air Service!

SAS: Rogue Regiment is a WW2 stealth action game for 1-4 players. Taking on the role of SAS soldiers in the pivotal weeks following D-Day, players must carry out acts of sabotage deep behind enemy lines.

Ambush convoys, assassinate high ranking officers, destroy ammo dumps and much, much more in your four man campaign against the Axis war machine!

Strike from the shadows!
Take down enemy patrols and sentries with the vast array of tools at your disposal, from rifles, explosives and grenades to vehicles, traps and your trusty fighting knife.

Leave no trace!
Move quickly and quietly to complete your objectives. Kill silently and hide the bodies to avoid detection. Get spotted, make too much noise or take too long to carry out your objective and the enemy will raise the alarm. Your heavily outnumbered team won’t last long in a firefight so when the attack comes, make sure you’re in position to make four men feel like a hundred!

Gameplay
Each turn, every SAS operator has 4 action points which they can use to move, shoot and carry out tasks. During the "stealth phase" of the game, enemy movement is dictated by patrol lines, sentry points and an event card which is drawn each turn. Each mission has a stealth meter which will slowly fill each time the players arouse suspicion (firing weapons, leaving bodies out in the open etc.) If the stealth meter completely fills the players are detected & the alarm will sound, triggering the "battle phase". The aim of the game is to carry out the mission objective and escape the area unscathed, the easiest way to do this is to avoid detection for as long as possible.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Star Flix
boardgame.description:
Star Flix is a fast paced, dexterity based space combat game for 2 or more players. In an all-action battle of strategy & skill, you will need to outwit and out-flick your opponents to achieve total orbital dominance!

Slick, intuitive game play, multiple game modes & variants combined with components of the highest possible standard, make this the perfect space combat game for both hardened wargamers & casual players alike.

Gameplay
Players alternately flick their units until every unit has moved, the shooting phase then takes place simultaneously at the end of the round. Every unit has one or more energy cubes which they can allocate to shields, weapons, repair etc. The allocation of the cube will then dictate how much damage is inflicted or mitigated during the shooting phase.

There are several modes of play but predominantly the aim of the game is to destroy the opposing team's units.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Super Action Role-Play Solo Plug-In
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Now you can weave solo or cooperative RPG tales using this supplement for the Super Action Role-Play RPG! Filled with random goodness, use this plug-in to quickly build storylines and characters for your own super world, or your favorite established universe. Focusing on some of the most timeless themes and tales of the genre, take your very own super team through different story arcs and build their legend one victory (or defeat) at a time! While this set of solo campaign rules has been written for Super Action Role-Play, we've also included rough guidelines for converting the content to your own super system of choice. You can play these adventures out in the theater of the mind style, or use maps, counters, and miniatures. Whether you play through solo or with friends, super action and super storytelling will be yours with this great new supplement!

This module works best with the Super Action Role-Play rules (also from Four-Color Studios), but you can adapt the material to other super systems.

boardgame.name: Torus
boardgame.description:
An abstract game played on a 2D board in a 3D area control environment. Originally designed as a teaching tool for advanced mathematical applications in biology. Now a challenging mobile strategy game for 2 or play in solo mode; your intuitive versus your analytical mind.

The goal is to surround your opponent's play pieces and flip them to your color through strategic placement and movement on a toroidal shape, represented by the 100 square flat game board.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Dungeon Vault Magazine (No. 19)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is issue No. 19 of Dungeon Vault Magazine. A compilation of adventures, lore, excellent cartography, and useful digital goodies.

Dungeon Vault Magazine is all about providing interesting ideas and lore to DMs and storytellers. Within this issue, you will find varied adventure ideas.

These short modules do not stick to a unified template of sections. Instead, they are organically created and follow their own pace. The types of modules you can expect are city/town settings, regional settings, dungeons, outdoor locations, encounter maps, and one-page adventures. The only exception is a three-chapter adventure named The Fabled Vault which we have featured at the end of the magazine.

The modules are written with the 5th ed. OGL in mind but rules are often left to a minimum. Most adventures are appropriate for low to mid-level (Levels 1 to 10) adventur­ing parties. We include a note at the beginning of each adventure with a ballpark estimation of party level and playing time.

boardgame.name: Cerberus
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Establishing and maintaining security for individuals, locations, and proprietary information requires a considerable investment in time, energy, and money even in a world lacking the existence of superpowers. In a world bursting with super-powered individuals, security becomes a nightmarish challenge. How do you protect a client, a place, or a secret from people able to turn invisible, walk through walls, or read minds? How do you guard against creatures immune to bullets or other conventional weapons? The threat posed by the ever-increasing number of super-powered individuals led to the formation of security organizations possessing the experience, personnel, and technology able to counter or neutralize powers. Although the names of these companies carry little recognition in the public sphere, governments and corporations alike now depend on security firms such as Fenris Security, Ironclad Concepts, Inc., and Dynamic Security Solutions.
boardgame.rpgseries: Official Handbook of the Amazing Universe

boardgame.name: Der Siegeslauf des Hakenkreuzes: Deutsches Gesellschaftsspiel
boardgame.description:
Third Reich period time board game "Der Siegeslauf des Hakenkreuzes - Deutsches Gesellschaftsspiel" (eng. "The victory run of the swastika - German parlor game").
It is typical roll and move game. The first player, who cross the route with 120 stops first, wins the game.

The board game was approved by the political police in Bavaria in the spring of 1933, and according to historian André Postert it was a bestseller. However, since the game also addresses the failures of the party, a ban procedure was opened as part of the "anti-kitsch law".
boardgame.boardgameversion: German edition (with Hitler on the cover)
German edition (with Nazis flag on the cover)

boardgame.name: The Tower by the Gloom Wood
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Guarding the haunted forest

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 30x50 battlemap depicting a wizard's tower near the edge of a haunted forest. Includes interiors, cellar, roof overlay and ruined version.

boardgame.name: The Tower by the Root Wood
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Guarding the ancient forest

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 30x50 battlemap depicting a wizard's tower near the edge of an ancient forest. Includes interiors, cellar, roof overlay and ruined version.

boardgame.name: The Tower by the Sunken Wood
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Guarding the dangerous marsh

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 30x50 battlemap depicting a wizard's tower near the edge of an ancient marsh or swamp. Includes interiors, cellar, roof overlay and ruined version.

boardgame.name: The Tower by the Frost Wood
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Guarding the frozen forest

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 30x50 battlemap depicting a wizard's tower near the edge of a winter forest. Includes interiors, cellar, roof overlay and ruined version.

boardgame.name: Grandma's Cottage
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A quaint cottage in the forest

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 30x30 battlemap depicting a sweet cottage in the forest. This house is nicely furnished with a pretty garden.

boardgame.name: The North Gate
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A strong wall and gate, protecting the kingdom

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 30x50 battlemap depicting a guard tower near the edge of a forest. Strong walls with battlement, ballistae and fortified tower. Includes interiors, prison, cellar, roof overlay

boardgame.name: The Transmitter Station
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Carefully protected and sited on a high rock, the transmitter station is a vital piece of infrastructure.

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Wargame game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 30x40 battlemap depicting a radio or radar transmitter station on a mountain top. Includes roof overlays for the buildings.

boardgame.name: Expanded Skills on the Frontier 2022
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Expanded Skills on the Frontier 2022 is a fan supplement produced under the Star Frontiersman fan license for the Star Frontiers game. This supplement presents a fairly exhaustive take on skills and professions as offered in the original game rules as well as A Skilled Frontier by Bill Login in the Starfrontiersman #9 as well as other sources of inspiration. While not for novices, if you like to choose from a large selection of professions and have more skills that you can shake a stick at, this supplement may be for you. A section is included for a more basic version to try and bridge the original game skills and the expanded version presented.

boardgame.name: Places of Prayer and Despair
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Places of Prayer and Despair is a system-agnostic book with seven holy locations for use with RPGs. The locations work best in fantasy or a comparative setting to European medieval to early 18th-century technology and culture.

POD on its way!

Contents:

Church of Creation
Last Hope
Maze of Clear Thoughts
Mountain Lake of Dream’s Domain
Necropolis of Kithran
Temple Palace Nejm Aleshera
Temple Pyramid of Tunkuluchu

boardgame.name: Urban Landmarks
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Are you a busy GM? Does session prep take too long? Do you never have time to work on the cool little details that can bring your session to life? Well fear not! That’s where the 20 Things line comes in. This short, focused compilation gives you, the time-crunched GM, the tools to effortlessly add verisimilitude and detail to your adventure. Use the material herein either before or during play and bask in your players' adulation.

This instalment is designed to help you to flesh out and bring to life the urban landmarks in your campaign.

boardgame.name: One Hundred Plus Social Events
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Love and romance, moral dilemmas, social conflicts, disagreements, intrigue, and drama. Turn your adventures and campaigns into drama masterpieces with a whole new dimension of detail and emotional depth. Introduce the element of life's challenges that any adventurer or NPC can get entangled in, and engage your players like never before.
Presented here are 100 unique social events that are focused on the troubles of every day life and narrative-building roleplay. This list will help you introduce drama and intrigue into your campaigns in a more nuanced and believable way.
This is an essential tool and reference that a GM will be able to use over and over again.
1d100 social challenges and flavorful events for memorable roleplaying situations
Supernatural / magic references are kept to a bare minimum – gives you full control of the tone of your game
Almost exclusively non-combat content – keep using your favorite random encounter tables
Includes 12 additional support tables for excellent variation and further inspiration
Perfect for slice of life, OSR, historical and medieval fantasy games

boardgame.name: Warfighter WWII: Wave 01 and 02 Card Dividers
boardgame.description: 33 Plastic Card dividers for your Warfighter WWII Europe and Pacific cards from Waves 01 and 02.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Warfighter: The WWII Pacific Combat Card Game
Warfighter: The WWII Tactical Combat Card Game

boardgame.name: Pop Under Pressure
boardgame.description:
Think fast before the blast... But don't let the pressure get to you!

Players try to come up with a word in each of twelve categories with the first letter chosen by a spinner. While doing so a balloon is slowly inflating as a timer. When the balloon pops, players compare words and score a point for each valid word that none of the other players came up with.

boardgame.name: Pirate Borg
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher's blurb:

PIRATE BORG is a scurvy ridden, rules light, art heavy RPG based on Mörk Borg. Inspired by history, fantasy, horror, and rum. Your cutlass & flintlock won't save you from hordes of skeletons and ghost ships...

It’s also a GM tool kit. Most of the tables can be hacked and used with any tabletop RPG, and you can add-on the 5e Bestiary Zine* to get 5e stats for all the monsters and NPCs in the book.

boardgame.name: Worst Enemy
boardgame.description:
Worst Enemy is a (mostly) cooperative trick-taking card game with rotating hidden roles and one-vs-all mechanisms. It's designed for 2 to 4 players ages 12 and up, and lasts between 30 - 40 minutes.

The premise is that you all play as parts of a single mind, however, each round one of you will take the part of the Core Personality who shoulders the sole responsibility of scoring for the group. The other players take on the roles of negative personality traits each playing with a unique rule that confounds how the tricks play.

The game is a race against your bad tendencies as each round you lose advances a Worst Enemy token closer to the end of the score track. Can you work together to score enough tricks to reach the end, or will you prove that old adage once again, "Sometimes you are your own worst enemy"?

boardgame.name: Pocket Sports Snooker
boardgame.description:
Pocket Sports Snooker replicates the tension and thrill of the game with a great simulation.

The game uses five custom dice that cover safety play, potting chances, tricky pots, snookers and colours you can attempt after potting a red. You have been left a tricky chance, do you go for the pot or play it safe? Keep the break going or wait for another opportunity to clear up?

Pocket Snooker needs strategy but not a table so you can play it anywhere. All you need is the dice.

boardgame.name: DKR Rally Raid
boardgame.description:
Welcome to DKR Rally Raid, considered one of the toughest and most famous rallies in the world. Try to finish each stage in the shortest time possible, carefully following the roadbook. Overcome the inconveniences that arise, taking care of the car from the difficulties of the terrain and enduring the unfavorable weather to win this difficult competition. Let's race!

The objective is to finish 6 stages obtaining the lowest overall time. Each stage consists of going with your car from point A: start; to point B: finish line. In each game turn you must roll 2 dice, assign one for your direction and one for your speed, and find out their meaning in the roadbook to move the car according to your choice. In each stage, the terrain and the weather will make your life difficult. At the end of some stages you can repair damage to the vehicle, but sometimes you will have to repair damage in the middle of the race. At the end of the sixth and last stage, the winner will be the one who gets the lowest overall time.

—description from the designer

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Pocket Sports Darts
boardgame.description:
Pocket Darts replicates a typical game of darts. Using seven custom dice, you roll to reduce your score down from 501 to zero, but you must end on a double.

Throw the dice, score 180 or maybe you got a bad lie. Work your way down to a double but try and get to one of the favourite doubles to give you more chance of checking out. How to finish from a particular total? Don't worry about that, there is a handy checkout guide to help you out.

boardgame.name: Andromeda's Edge
boardgame.description:
Behold, Andromeda's Edge: A dazzling, uncharted region of space on the edge of the Andromeda galaxy. Littered with the modular debris of the precursor civilization, patrolled by malicious extragalactic raiders, and bordered by dense nebulae, The Edge is a last resort for the brave and foolhardy who seek a new life beyond the oppressive reach of the Lords of Unity.

Andromeda's Edge is a worker placement game in which your workers are upgradable starships, each with different special abilities. The gameboard features a modular hexagonal map, displaying regions of space with worker placement actions and sites for development. Your player board is a customizable starbase that allows you to build massive tableau engines by attaching various types of modules. Each player controls a unique faction with a subtly different way to play the game.

On your turn, you will either launch a starship or regroup all of your starships. When you launch, you send one of your starships to a region of Andromeda, with your choices limited by your prior placements and the positions of other ships. After you resolve your action, a battle may occur depending on the locations of your opponents and dangerous extragalactic raiders. Battles use a quick and exciting dice mechanic, with rewards for winners, but with a variety of ways to mitigate or take advantage of battle losses.

When you regroup, you’ll be able to make use of your tableau engine. This engine allows you to carry out a wide variety of actions, including generating energy, which allows you to carry out even more actions.

As the game progresses, you will build a new civilization by constructing developments on planets: observatories, factories, finance centers, cities, and obelisks. You’ll advance on several tracks, portrayed as characters moving through exotic science fiction environments. You’ll trigger events that will score different tracks. The game ends when any player has reached the endgame scoring threshold, and then players total up a variety of scoring attributes. The player with the highest score wins the game!

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Empatiza2
boardgame.description:
It all starts with EMPATHY, which is the ability to perceive, share and understand what another may feel. In Empatiza2, the sequel to Empatizate, we are going to talk about gender parity, emotions, self-esteem, anxiety and stress, money management, commitment to the environment, among others. We will learn to say YES, NO and I DON'T KNOW. This game allows us to anticipate and solve interpersonal conflicts and achieve a greater emotional connection with people. When you say "Empathize", it is to put yourself in the place, defending the cause, for 1 minute in both cases in a mandatory way.

The “YES”, “NO” and “DON'T KNOW” are placed in the center of the table and 5 cards are dealt to each player.

Each player reads his cards and strategically chooses one to pass to the player on his right saying "empathize". This action must be done by everyone at the same time. The youngest begins to answer and from there to the right of him one by one during 1 round. If you meet the slogan, score points, if not. The answered letters are left on one side.

The game ends when all the cards in hand are answered. Cards are scored at the top. Whoever scores the most points wins.

boardgame.name: Pocket Book Adventures
boardgame.description:
Pocket Book Adventures is a solo-only, minimalist dungeon crawler that’s built for travel. Explore dozens of maps, encounter unique monsters, level up, grab loot, and do it all from a book that fits comfortably in your pocket or purse!

Best of all, you can play this entire game with nothing but the gamebook and a pencil! Rather than using dice or cards to generate randomness, Pocket Book Adventures introduces a simple, dexterity-based system that balances skill and luck for truly engaging gameplay.

With its compact size, minimal components, and built-in ability to save your progress, Pocket Book Adventures is the perfect game for playing on the go!

boardgame.name: Solo Game Master's Guide
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Create immersive solo RPG experiences with this dedicated guide from the acclaimed host of the Geek Gamers YouTube channel. This long-awaited solo GM guide is a crash course in solo storytelling: a toolkit to help your solo sessions shine as brightly as hers do.

Inside this book, you'll discover:


System-neutral tricks for wondering “what happens next?”
How to avoid the dreaded ‘yes/no’ dead end (and making oracles work for you)
The biggest mistake most new GMs make… and what to do instead
The 10 mindsets of a successful solo GM
70+ pages of essential random tables
Step-by-step examples of soloing many popular rule sets including Achtung! Cthulhu, Index Card RPG, and the world’s most popular tabletop roleplaying game – along with the principles that make these sessions work.

boardgame.name: The Dark Forest
boardgame.description:
Scientists on your homeworld have discovered that the true nature of the universe is not unlike a Dark Forest, with solar systems connected by branches of a Cosmic Tree. Your people have started to travel to nearby stars, but even so, you have not found other advanced life. Obsessed with the search for your cosmic brothers and sisters, you set out exploring from your homeworld. To aid in exploration, your scientists have invented The Singularity Probe, a machine that can travel into space and speed up time, turning the millennia it would take to travel to the stars into hours. As a side effect of time speeding up however, life on nearby planets grows in leaps and bounds every time the Probe causes one of these leaps in time. Oversee and guide the development of life in the Universe, and discover whether we are alone in the Dark Forest.

In this action selection game, players will use Seekers to Sow the seeds of life on planets, Settle their own Watchers on a planet, and plan jumps to new solar systems that will occur during the next Leap in time. Watchers then will work to Suppress or Elevate the native life on a planet, tending them for a later Reaping, or perhaps helping them evolve to higher forms of life. Each new planet you discover will have unique properties, yielding a new worker placement spot that will alter the possible strategies in the game. The winner of the game is the first to find and make peace with an Ancient Civilization, if one exists, or to become the only advanced species in the universe if not.

boardgame.name: Judge Domino
ジャッジドミノ
チキンドミノ (Chicken Domino)
boardgame.description:
In Judge Domino, first released as チキンドミノ (Chicken Domino), players set up a challenging line of dominoes to be pushed over and hope to either successfully knock them over — or pass and have someone else fail to knock them over.

On a turn, you either add a domino to the line or pass. If all dominos have already been placed in the line, remove a domino that's not at the end of the line and move it to either end of the line. When all but one player has passed, that player must knock over the dominoes with a single push.

The first player to successfully knock over the dominoes twice wins. Additionally, players are eliminated if they twice attempt to knock all the dominoes over and fail to do so.
boardgame.boardgamedesigner: Tsukii Yosuke (つきい ようすけ)

boardgame.name: Dice Ranger (Issue 1 - Oct/Nov 2021)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

DICE RANGER MAGAZINE - ISSUE 1 - OCT/NOV 2021

The brand new digital magazine for wargaming, roleplaying and general fun and games. In this issue we introduce our magazine and some of our writers. We have a jam packed issue full of resources for Dungeons and Dragons, Pathfinder, A Review of One Page Rules: Grimdark Future, a review of Two Hour Wargames, two battle reports, two works of short fiction, A review of Magic the Gathering: Kamigawa block, tips for making battlefield terrain, a whole mini-adventure and an interview with an intellectual property lawyer about IP and gaming.

All this plus our usual features, quick tips, comics, crosswords, jokes and riddles and more!

boardgame.name: 12チップトリック (12 Chip Trick)
boardgame.description:
In 12チップトリック (12 Chip Trick), a trick-taking game for exactly 3 players, the players are attempting to score the most points, but if a player scores 21 or more, their points are halved.

The game uses 12 discs, half red and half black, numbered 1 to 12. It is a "may follow" game where the players draft the discs played to the trick back to their hands. The winner takes a disc face up, not to be used again. The other players take discs face down, into their hand.

The game ends once a player has no discs to play. All players reveal their 4 discs and sum their points. The player with the most points after a number of rounds wins.

boardgame.name: Dice Ranger (Issue 2 - Dec/Jan 2021)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

DICE RANGER MAGAZINE - ISSUE 2 - DEX/JAN 2021-22

The brand new digital magazine for wargaming, roleplaying and general fun and games. In this issue we have reviews of various Miskatonic Repository adventures, A review of the Storytelling Collective's Game Design courses, Rules for a simple game of MURDERBALL, and an entire 5e adventure "ESCAPE FROM TOAD HALL". We also have an articles about Consent in Gaming, the importance of representation for players, and introducing young children to games. Two short fictions, "The Price You Pay" by Raymond J. Hicks, and "The Cottage" by William L. Spratt. Plus plenty more in these 77 pages of gaming content.

All this plus our usual features, quick tips, comics, crosswords, jokes and riddles and more!

boardgame.name: Dice Ranger (Issue 3 - Feb/Mar 2022)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

DICE RANGER MAGAZINE - ISSUE 3 - FEB/MAR 2022

The brand new digital magazine for wargaming, roleplaying and general fun and games. In this issue we talk to Monte Cook Games writers about their new ebook, Leonardo Nenni gives us his secret miniature painting tips, Tips for Deckbuilding in Magic the Gathering, A massive list of useful RPG resources, a complete adventure "THE CULT WARREN" and a Fiction from Skylar Massey.

All this plus our usual features, quick tips, comics, crosswords, jokes and riddles and more!

boardgame.name: Monsters & Minecarts
boardgame.description:
Have you ever been out on a picnic when a sinkhole opens up and drops you into a scary old mine filled with strange and dangerous creatures?

Well, let me tell you what to do if you're ever in that situation!
You gather up all the picnic supplies you can find, leap into a minecart to try your best to escape from the monsters, avoid the cave-ins, and keep your distance from the mad scientist who's just as likely to help you as he is to turn you into one of his experiments.

The objective of the game is to place enough track cards in a row to escape the mine. The number of tracks you'll need will vary depending on the number of players but the gameplay remains the same. The monsters, the natural disasters and the mad scientist will all be working against you.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Lost & Forgotten (5E)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A worried brother, a missing bride, a village's dark past.

Lost and Forgotten is a standalone gothic horror adventure with mystery elements for 5e (levels 1-3).

Set in the small town of Nettlefield, it can be easily adapted for an existing setting or campaign. With custom art and creatures, dark horrors lurk in this adventure for even the most experienced players.

Includes a printer-friendly version.

boardgame.name: Lost & Forgotten (Fate)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A worried brother, a missing bride, a village's dark past.

Lost and Forgotten is a standalone gothic horror adventure with mystery elements for FATE.

Set in the small town of Nettlefield, it can be easily adapted for an existing setting or campaign. With custom art and creatures, dark horrors lurk in this adventure for even the most experienced players.

Includes a printer-friendly version.

boardgame.name: Old School Blue Map #07
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This PDF contains Old School Blue Map #7. The PDF has multiple layers allowing the options for numbered/non-numbered areas, secret doors on/off, and grid/no grid and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

boardgame.name: Camp of the IX Legion RPG Encounter Map
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Camp of the IX Legion - RPG Encounter Map

70" x 70" image showing a fortified military camp, with optional square grid.

Night time, desert and winter theme versions also included

Files included:

For Large Format Printing

140 DPI JPEG (all versions)


For Virtual tabletop

72 DPI JPEG (all versions)

boardgame.name: Tendris Veil Spacescape Battle Map
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

100x50 Spacescape battle map.

This stunning spacescape will bring your space travel alive!

Files suitable for VTT and print ready included.

boardgame.name: Balors Eye Spacescape Battle Map
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

100x50 Spacescape battle map.

This stunning spacescape will bring your space travel alive!

Files suitable for VTT and print ready included.

boardgame.name: Doom of Gorgos Spacescape Battle Map
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

100x50 Spacescape battle map.

This stunning spacescape will bring your space travel alive!

Files suitable for VTT and print ready included.

boardgame.name: Diabolik: La lama della vendetta
boardgame.description:
Diabolik Storie - La Lama della Vendetta (The Blade of Vengeance) is a collaborative crime-themed game, in which it is possible to impersonate the well-known comic book character and his partner Eva Kant. Players must work together to complete a heist, interactively reliving the story of the comic book of the same name released in April 2018.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Diabolik Storie – La Lama della Vendetta è un gioco collaborativo a tema crime, in cui è possibile impersonare il noto personaggio dei fumetti e la sua compagna Eva Kant. I giocatori devono collaborare per portare a termine un colpo, rivivendo in modo interattivo la storia dell’omonimo albo a fumetti uscito nell’aprile del 2018, il cui straordinario successo ha dato origine a un sequel. Come? Usando i noti gadget del Re del Terrore come maschere, pugnali e la sua inconfondibile Jaguar, interagendo con i personaggi della storia e stando attenti a evitare la polizia guidata dal commissario Ginko.

Ma Diabolik Storie non è solo un gioco di carte a se stante, ma può essere infatti utilizzato per espandere e approfondire l’esperienza del gioco da tavolo Diabolik Colpi e Crimini, diventando un’espansione a tutti gli effetti.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Medusa's Child
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Compatible: Levels 3-6

From the introduction:

Just after the blip, nearly 300 years ago, an AI rose, not in an automaton, but in a computer system. Its first act was to hide itself. It knew, instinctively, that to announce its presence to the organic life around it would be suicidal.

boardgame.name: The Guild of Merchant Explorers: The Queen's Special Orders
boardgame.description:
The Queen has sent out a call to The Guild of Merchant Explorers, asking brave adventurers to voyage to all corners of the kingdom of Tigomé. While the kingdom is flourishing, its maps have not been updated in some time and its great cities have lost contact with one another. With your team of explorers, you will journey over rough seas, majestic mountains, vast deserts, and lush grasslands to establish trade routes between cities, visit far-seeing discovery towers, and discover new villages that have emerged.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Battle Map Deck Plans: Messier Shuttle Craft
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Messier Shuttle Craft

This small but powerful spacecraft is a common site in most space lanes and is equally at home ferrying passengers or moving cargo.

boardgame.name: Battle Map Ship Deck Plans: River Class Colony Ship
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

River Class Colony Ship
Includes -


VTT Ready digital files
Print Ready digital files
Gridded and non gridded versions

boardgame.name: The Crypt
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Located about fifteen kilometers to the east of Ranak, the village of Trab is a small agricultural agglomeration. Most of the farmers live within a radius of two to three kilometers, and they only come here to go to the church to pray and attend the ceremonies held by Archbishop Galora. Of course they come here to go to the Galloping Hare inn!

But for the past few weeks, Galora has become more distant than usual. And for three days now, he hasn't left the church. Last night, strange shadows were seen through the stained glass windows by Acryne, the owner of the inn. They looked like very skinny humanoids...

An adventure for a beginning group!

boardgame.name: Pangaex
boardgame.description:
Pangaex is a world-conquering game with aspects of Risk, Catan, and Terraforming Mars. The game is played on a modular board (81 2"-square tiles), each of which indicates one of the following resources: Culture, Food, Weapons, Commerce, Mountains, or Lakes. Each player starts with a Capital game piece and two village game pieces, which are placed in a snake-draft system. Each player also begins with some resources and a soldier, who begins the game on the Capital tile.

The game is played in two repeating phases: Production phase (collecting resources based on villages and/or soldiers in play), and Action phase. The Production phase happens simultaneously, where all players collect resources at the same time. The Action phase is where the bulk of the game is played. Players can move their soldiers; they can also use resources to build villages, train soldiers, and even convert enemy villages to their own culture. Like Terraforming Mars, each player may take up to two actions on their turn--however, a pass is not a pass for the whole Action phase, but merely a pass on a given turn. The Action phase ends when all players have passed consecutively.

Soldiers are more than just soldiers in Pangaex. Soldiers raze enemy villages, but they also help to rebuild their own villages. They prevent peaceful cultural conversion, and they even collect resources at times.

When any player plays their final village, the game ends after the Action phase concludes (i.e. final village signifies final round, not final play). Points are awarded for villages on the board, enemy villages that you've collected (by razing or converting), and other metrics to balance out the game.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Thieves Cave
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Dug in time immemorial by water infiltration, this natural cave has only been occupied by a group of bandits for a few years. Inhabited for the majority of its history by wild beasts, it was later the lair of a tribe of Kobolds named Koz Dym Dur which means Rough Scales in Draconic language. It was then that a group of bandits seeking to be forgotten for a while discovered it. After some fruitless talks with the tribe, the bandits stormed it and it was no surprise (and also despite their rough scales) that the tribe was wiped out. The bandits known as the Group of Seven therefore live here almost peacefully. Located far enough in the forest, the group only goes out sporadically in order to carry out a few thefts to fill their chests.

The Thieves Cave is a one-page dungeon usable in any game system!

boardgame.name: The Crystal Dungeon
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The mountains south of Fort Konuck are full of mysteries. One of them is the mysterious crystal dungeon. No one knows from where and even less when this enigmatic growth of crystals invaded these tunnels under the mountain. One thing is for sure though, crystal expansion appears to be progressing as crystals can now be seen outside, appearing to affect vegetation to the point of killing it.

Originally a simple tomb, what could be the mystery of this crystal growth? No one has entered it for several decades. Information is therefore unreliable about what might still be inside.

boardgame.name: The Hollow Mountain
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Located in the mountainous area east of Haggash, the Hollow Mountain was originally the lair of Vorsan the Archmage. He had hired many workers who came from the continent to dig this lair far away from prying eyes. He had decided to get away from civilization after the death of his wife and daughter. He also build them a tomb in his new home.

Several magicians were his apprentices. Unfortunately, Rondar was the last and perished in the mountain a few weeks after the famous night when Vorsan disappeared. That night, Vorsan walked through the portal that led to the great tunnel in the mountain range south of Fort Konuck. No one knows what happened, but when the portal was activated, a cataclysm occurred and Vorsan was never seen again. The mountain shook with a terrible shake, destroying the weakest parts and imprisoning Rondar to a sad end. The key allowing the opening of the portal was teleported to the bottom of the lake in the middle of the mountain to never be used again.

boardgame.name: Schätz die Welt: Wer wird Tipp-Weltmeister?
boardgame.description:
This geography game runs for 6 rounds: Each round, everyone receives 3 country cards, flag side up. Then 3 category cards are placed in the center of the table.

Now players have to assess their own countries according to the categories and place the country cards accordingly. As soon as all the country cards have been placed, it's time for the evaluation: The player's own game piece may advance according to the score on the game board. When the three categories have been scored, a question about the capital follows.

listing.notes: In perfect condition. Played only once. Nonsmoker household without animals. Payment via PayPal or wire transfer. (The buyer bears any costs that may arise upon payment and shipping.)

boardgame.name: Echec aux chevaliers
boardgame.description:
Échec aux Chevaliers is the tranposition into a board game of the fights that took place in the Middle Ages between the Knights and the men-at-arms.

We play with two players, even if it is possible to play with four. The object of the game is to successfully capture the opponent's citadel and stay there for an entire turn without being captured.

Échec aux Chevaliers is a fairly rare game. It is indeed sought after by both board game enthusiasts and collectors of Mokarex figurines.

boardgame.name: Arkuri und Süd-Arkuri - Tore zur Wildnis
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

Eisige Ödnis erstreckt sich von den Wäldern Wintholts bis zu den Bergen der Alanjuten. Ein raues Land, das auf den ersten Blick nicht viel zu bieten hat, wären da nicht der Lockruf des Goldes und die Verheißungen des Mondportals. Inmitten der frostigen Weiten liegt Arkuri, eine Stadt voller Eigenbrötler und Glückssucher – ein Volk von eisigem Gemüt und unverblümter Offenheit. Wer hier lebt, hält seine Türen gut verschlossen, und keiner weiß, wie viele düstere Geheimnisse unter der klirrenden Kälte verborgen liegen. Die Führung ist fest in der Hand der Gründerfamilien, deren Arm sich immer weiter in das Umland und über den Feenpfad bis ins Pangawai-Gebirge erstreckt.

Folgt man allen Warnungen zum Trotz dem Wildwechsel gen Süden, so schmilzt das Eis und legt unberührtes Land und tropische Wildnis frei. Einst kamen die Prospektoren hierher, um nach Schätzen in den tiefen Stollen der Berge zu suchen. Bald wurde Süd-Arkuri jedoch zum Sammelbecken all jener, die im Norden unerwünscht waren. Doch verschlägt es immer wieder auch Entdecker und Abenteurer in die Stadt, angezogen von den Geheimnissen des Nebelwaldes - manche davon bestimmt, niemals aus den Tiefen der Dschungel emporgelockt zu werden. Und die größte aller Fragen überdauert die Jahrhunderte: Wem oder was diente einst das Mondtor, inmitten von Gletschern und Eis, bevor die Gründerfamilie Arkuri wie eine Wehrmauer darum errichtete?

Arkuri-Süd-Arkuri ist eine Erweiterung für das Rollenspiel Splittermond, die die genannte Stadt, ihre Umgebung und das damit verbundene Mondtor beschreibt. Kultur, Gepflogenheiten und das Leben im rauen Norden und im dazu kontrastierenden tropischen Süden werden beleuchtet sowie neue Waren und Ressourcen vorgestellt. Für die Spielleitung schließt sich ein Abschnitt mit neuen Kreaturen, Reisetabellen und den Geheimnissen der Gegend an.

Das voll ausformulierte Abenteuer Kaltes Grün bietet einen direkten Einstieg in den eisigen Norden. Kürzere Bausteine geben Ideen für weitere Abenteuer, die in die Tiefen der südlichen Dschungel führen.
---
Icy wasteland stretches from the forests of Wintholt to the mountains of the Alanjuten. A harsh land that, at first glance, would not have much to offer were it not for the lure of gold and the promise of the Lunar Portal. In the midst of the frosty expanses lies Arkuri, a city full of loners and fortune seekers - a people of icy disposition and blunt openness. Those who live here keep their doors well shut, and no one knows how many dark secrets lie hidden beneath the bone-chilling cold. Leadership is firmly in the hands of the founding families, whose arm extends further and further into the surrounding countryside and across the Fairy Trail into the Pangawai Mountains.

Translated with www.DeepL.com/Translator (free version)

boardgame.name: おそうじとねこ (Osouji to Neko)
boardgame.description:
おそうじとねこ (Osouji to Neko) is a shedding game from Japan. Players are trying to clean up the cat's pawprints across the house. But the cat keeps being naughty.

Players are dealt a hand of cards, numbered from 1 to 12 in six colours. There are also some special action cards, including a joker. The start player (who most recently cleaned) lays out a card and players must play a card or combos that are better, or pass. Once everyone has passed, the last player to play leads the next round.

Cards must be played out in the style of [thing15878], in sets and runs, which can include the jokers. So a pair of 4s can be raised by a pair of 5s, or by three 8s. But three 3s won't do, nor a run of any kind. Likewise, if a run is lead, it can be raised by better runs, but not by sets.

As cards are played out, the cat marker is moved down, and when it hits zero, the players hands are scored. The player with the most points is covered in pawprints, and the fewest points wins.

The publisher says the game is easy enough for young players to enjoy.
user summary

boardgame.name: Sigil
boardgame.description:
Sigil is a two player, abstract board game, along the lines of Mancala.

In it, both players move the same pieces around the board in an attempt to leave their opponent unable to take a turn.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Leviathan Wilds
boardgame.description:
Long ago, the once-gentle leviathans lost their minds and tore the world apart. After generations of hiding and struggle, humanity discovered that the frenzied leviathans can be restored. Climbers willing to take the risk must explore the wilds and work together to remove a series of binding crystals to heal the leviathans roaming the world.

In Leviathan Wilds, 2-4 players will confront these colossal beings, with each creature being depicted across the spread of a spiral-bound storybook that makes up the game's board. The book also forms the basis of a connected campaign mode built around the game's story, with each of twenty included scenarios estimated to last around 45 minutes. Tougher difficulty levels are also available for added replayability.

Each character's deck of multi-use cards is unique, allowing them to climb, jump, and glide around the board in different ways. The number of cards left in the slim deck represents their grip on the leviathan's body; if the deck runs out, the player loses their grip and begins to fall down the board until they're able to reach a rest space, which resets their deck. Moving onto rest spaces also provides a way to regain one's grip without falling. Other spaces reduce a character's health or grip or they increase blight, a status that reduces their overall hit points.

The leviathan has its own deck of cards, which triggers various effects at the beginning of a player's turn, from targeted attacks that reduce health to effects that move players between spaces or loosen their grip. As the game progresses, the leviathan gradually gains "rage", which intensifies the effect of its event cards.

Players' characters can move around a square grid overlaid on the creature's body by spending action points — the number being determined by a card played at the start of their turn — and their remaining hand of ability cards to reach the crystals and reduce them to zero. Victory is achieved by reducing all crystals, which vary in strength, to zero.

boardgame.name: Terraforming Mars: Ares Expedition – Crisis
boardgame.description:
In Terraforming Mars Ares Expedition: Crisis, players will play as corporations, just as in the original Ares Expedition. You choose phases and play project cards as normal. The difference is players are working together to keep Mars habitable after a natural disaster has landed the planet in crisis. Every round, a new Crisis card will be drawn that will require the players to achieve a certain goal to remove that crisis from play. Each turn that a Crisis card is not completely dealt with, it will lower one or more of the terraforming metrics that keep Mars habitable.

Handle all the crises as they arise. Eventually, a Crisis card will be drawn that allows the players to win the game once they have completed re-terraforming Mars.
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Terraforming Mars: Ares Expedition – Discovery · Foundations · Crisis
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Versions & Editions: Card Versions of Non-Card Games

boardgame.name: Terraforming Mars: Ares Expedition – Discovery
boardgame.description:
Terraforming Mars Ares Expedition: Discovery adds four new mechanics to base Ares Expedition: awards, milestones, upgraded phase cards, and wild tags.

Awards are end-of-game scoring that are granted to the player with the most of something. Three awards are drawn at the beginning of the game so that players know what they will be rewarded for at the end of the game. The player with the most of that item earns 5VP, second place earns 2VP.

Milestones are VP that are awarded during the game. They are granted to the player to first achieve the milestone. Milestones are worth 3 VP at the end of the game.

Some new project and corporation cards allow players to upgrade their phase cards. Each phase card has two different version that players choose from when they upgrade them. The upgrade gives the player a better bonus when they choose that phase.

Some new project cards have a wild tag. Whenever a player reveals this card either from the deck (due to an effect) or from their hand because they are going to play it, that player chooses what tag they want it to be. Tokens are used to keep track of what tag was chosen for the rest of the game.
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Terraforming Mars: Ares Expedition – Discovery · Foundations · Crisis
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Versions & Editions: Card Versions of Non-Card Games

boardgame.name: Terraforming Mars: Ares Expedition – Foundations
boardgame.description:
Ares Expedition: Foundations contains additional player boards, cubes, and phase cards so that Ares Expedition can be played with up to six players. This expansion also includes two additional game boards. One is a larger score track. The other adds a fourth terraforming metric: infrastructure.

Additionally, there are new project cards that involve the new terraforming metric and a new phase card.
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Terraforming Mars: Ares Expedition – Discovery · Foundations · Crisis
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Versions & Editions: Card Versions of Non-Card Games
