boardgame.name: Warpgate: Beyond
boardgame.description:
New Expansion for Warpgate, a fast-paced game of galactic conquest. Includes new and reworked Objectives, new Tactics, Technologies, a separate deck for Solo AI, and more!

Warpgate: Beyond replaces all cards in the base game, and adds new ones, bringing the total to 242 cards (not counting the "Daily Unlocks").

Hero, Basic and Advanced Tactics cards were rebalanced and many new ones were added.
All Technology cards were reworked and rebalanced.
Two Solo-AI action decks are included in the expansion, enhancing the solo experience.
Objective cards now have partial completion mechanism, existing Objectives were reworked or rebalanced and new ones were added.

A copy of the base game is required to play this expansion.

boardgame.name: Edgeguard
boardgame.description:
By our calendar, the third day of the month of storms was when our world changed forever. Each of the leaders of the five great nations were assassinated by an unknown force, leaving the councils and elders fumbling to reply to this unknown threat. Many laid blame at the feet of ancestral hatreds. The Dwarves blamed the Goblins. The Orcs blamed the Elves. The Humans blamed the Orcs. and the Goblins blamed everyone, as befits their fear and paranoia. What the secretive Elves believe is a thing of mystery...though perhaps you will be the one to uncover the truth?

The Edgeguard is to be a force of elite warriors, rangers, clerics, mages, and rogues—the best of the best. Each nation will contribute forces with a mandate to seek out our mysterious new enemy and report back to their leaders. From these humble beginnings, five heroes will arise, one from each nation, to become our champions⁠—the defenders of Ebonmoor.

Edgeguard is a story-driven tabletop miniatures game for 1-4 players drawing mechanical inspiration from classic experiences across both table and screen—featuring highly detailed miniatures, immersive mechanics, and beautiful artwork.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Tetra Tower
boardgame.description: Players draw cards and must place the piece that matches the image on the card on the moving platform. Players alternate stacking their pieces until the tower collapses.

boardgame.name: The Thing with the Ring (Second Edition)
boardgame.description:
Robbits (the nickname for Urban Halflings) are a small mischievous folk with an uncanny habit of ‘finding’ ancient relics of vast and horrifying power. In this case, a troublesome Ring, belonging to an evil wizard called Nörmün. Nörmün has sent his Goblins to retrieve the Ring, even as the Wizard Gudgrief tries to form a Party of Dwarves, Elves and Robbits to take the Ring away on a Quest.

But the reluctant Robbits know that nobody ever comes back from Gudgrief’s Quests, so the Dwarves are forced to Press-Gang and the Elves to Enchant them out of their Pits to join the Party. However, Robbits are innately ‘Tricksy’ and will use Magic and Excuses to avoid going on the Quest. Only one Robbit will live to tell the epic tale of...
The Thing with the Ring!

In The Thing with the Ring, you take on the role of a Robbit and the object of the game is to avoid going on the Quest to get rid of the evil Ring. Dwarves, Elves and Goblins will turn up on your doorstep and you must manage them with Magic and Excuses or risk joining the Party and going on the Quest.

The Game is for one to six Players and it is comprised of one Rulebook, one hundred cards, and one die, known as the Battle Die.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Polyhedral Potions
boardgame.description:
Polyhedral Potions is a roll & write dice drafting game using a set of 7 polyhedral dice for 2-5 players, with a solo variant. Players will use the dice (Ingredients) to craft different types of Potions and Poisons in order to earn Stars and points for making Distillations and Fulminates.

On your turn you’ll complete three steps:

1. Draft Ingredients and mark them on the Ingredients chart on your score sheet.
2. Combine the Ingredients to Craft a Potion and mark that on the Potion chart
3. Use the Potion (or Poison).

The game ends when someone earns their third Star. Finish the round. The person to the right of the first player will take the last turn. Then proceed to scoring.

Solo Variant
The solo game plays in about 20 minutes and presents a challenge similar to playing a multiplayer game. Challenge yourself to earn the highest rank possible. Will you become a potion Wizard? There are also 19 Potion Brewing Feats you can try to accomplish!

boardgame.name: Go Make A Hike
boardgame.description:
Go Make a Hike is a competitive tile drafting and placement game for 2-4 players (with a solo mode) about building the perfect hiking path. Each round, players will draft either a Trail or Destination tile to add to their Trail System. Destinations require certain features along their trail: Water, Flowers, Wildlife, or Viewpoints.

As players work to build the perfect hike their trails will grow and spread across the table in an impressive display of nature's beauty!

Solo mode included.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Go Make A Hike: Off the Beaten Path

boardgame.name: Polyhedral Perils
boardgame.description:
In Polyhedral Perils you and any other number of players are heroes whose hobby is exploring dungeons, battling the monsters who dwell there, and bragging about your exploits. But who is the greatest hero? You decide to hold a competition to determine, once and for all, who the hero with the greatest prestige is.

All you need to play Polyhedral Perils is a set of seven polyhedral dice (D4, D6, D8, D10, D%, D12, and D20), something to keep score, and some competitors (or play solo - see below).

Taking turns, each hero will attempt to defeat the strongest monster they can. As monsters are defeated you'll earn Prestige. Head back to the village to brag about your exploits at any time to secure your Prestige, but if you are defeated you'll return dejected and forlorn and earn much less Prestige.

Polyhedral Perils Solo In the solo variant, you are trapped deep within the dungeon and must fight your way to escape. There is no Prestige, you are fighting for your life! You must defeat enough monsters to escape the dungeon before you perish.

Polyhedral Perils: The Champion's Journey
The Champion’s Journey is a way to play a campaign mode of Polyhedral Perils. This is a solo adventure that can be played in one or several sessions and will take about 30-40 minutes to complete. You’ll track your progress across multiple games with additional challenges and abilities as you progress through locations on the map of the Kingdom of Petitia. Each location must be defeated before you can move to the next location. Each location will have a new challenge that must be overcome, but doing so will give you a benefit that you can use in future challenges.

boardgame.name: Polyhedral Predicaments: Dungeon Demise
boardgame.description:
In Polyhedral Predicaments - Dungeon Demise you are a hero delving deep into a dungeon in search of treasures. You'll encounter a maze of rooms, each with a powerful enemy, weapons and tools that will help you on your journey, as well as coins and gems. Collect what you can, survive if you are able, and defeat the dungeon boss at the end to earn a trove of valuables!

Polyhedral Predicaments is a series within a series! These are small, 18-card games that share similar mechanics as you go on adventures and survive disasters.

boardgame.name: Invasion: The Conquest of Kings
boardgame.description:
Invasion is a military strategy game where players manage resources, expand their kingdoms, forge alliances, and wage war against their enemies.

The map is constructed by the players by placing land tiles. This means the map is different in every game of Invasion! By placing castles on the land tiles, players collect different resources, which will allow them to build roads and castles, buy soldiers, and purchase advantage cards.

A player’s king is their most valuable piece in the game. A king’s army is more powerful, can move quicker, and can siege an enemy castle more easily. A king can only be killed when all soldiers in their army are dead, so players need to be strategic about how many soldiers they put in their king’s army, and how they weaken their enemies’ armies.

Killing an enemy king gives that player a king’s crown token, and the first player to gain two king’s crown tokens wins the game. Players of Invasion will need to juggle using their king’s offensive capabilities, with protecting them from their enemies. Players will siege castles, block their enemies’ movement, kill their soldiers, and battle their king’s army in an all out war to decide who is the most powerful kingdom in the land.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Caught in the Act
boardgame.description:
Hanki-Panki is going on. Sex is a natural part of life. But the question is Who? is doing What? to Whom? and Where?

This game is your chance to be an investigative reporter and uncover the naked truth. If you are the first plater to correctly catch a couple in the act - YOU WIN!!!

On your turn, roll the dice to determine how many spaces you can move. When you reach a room, ask another player to reveal one fact they know. Keep your notes and try to narrow down who did what, to whom, and where.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Mechanism: Give a Clue / Get a Clue

boardgame.name: Monsters of the Forbidden Woods (PF2)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Danger and Death Awaits in the Forbidden Woods

Deep in the heart of the Forbidden Woods lies a group of monsters too terrifying for most to face. Animals of enormous size, creatures part spider and bear, terrifying crocodile beavers, and things much, much worse. Only the bravest heroes dare to stand up to these foul abominations of murderous intent and save the people from a fate far worse than death.

Monsters of the Forbidden Woods is an exciting new supplement of monsters in Jon Brazer Enterprises’ best-selling Book of Beasts series and is our first for the Pathfinder Second Edition Roleplaying Game. These monsters are designed to frighten characters and leave your players recounting their tales of heroism time and again. Inside this volume, you’ll find:

22 new monsters, ranging from levels –1 to 10
Items found in the monsters’ lairs, giving you ready ideas for a treasure horde
In-game descriptions of each monster, ranging from random NPC quotes to colloquial names given to the monster by nearby locals
Adventure hooks for using these monsters in unique and exciting ways
Battle suggestions with descriptions on how best to build an encounter


Face What Goes Bump in the Night.

boardgame.name: Just Spearmasters
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The crusading champion class from Pathfinder Roleplaying Game embodies martial might in service of a glorious purpose, now with the possibility to serve multiple alignments. Of course, if you want to stay in the classic devotion to law and goodness of the old-school paladin, you can embrace the just spearmaster cause with 10 terrific class options and champion feats like unyielding lancet, spearhead the legion, archon's lance, and aura of civilization, plus the awesome attunement of the seeking spearhead focus spell!

boardgame.name: Blaster Bolts (#3 - 105 Miles to Beaumont)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Blaster Bolts is a new zine that features material for White Star: White Box Science Fiction Roleplaying and short science fiction.

This issue of Blaster Bolts features

A new class by system creator James M. Spahn - the Cyber-Pilot
A new story by scifi writer Kendra Leigh Speedling - 105 Miles to Beaumont

boardgame.name: My Little Pony: Adventures in Equestria Deck-Building Game – Familiar Faces Expansion
boardgame.description: My Little Pony: Adventures in Equestria Deck-Building Game – Familiar Faces Expansion adds more cards to My Little Pony: Adventures in Equestria Deck-Building Game.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: My Little Pony: Adventures in Equestria Deck-Building Game

boardgame.name: Towers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Enter a wonderful 18th Century twisted fairytale fantasy.

Includes 40 Narrated Soundscapes to make it even more theatrical and exciting!

The StoryMaster's Tales has been created to be a quick, easy and fun way of experiencing role-playing without the problem of learning lots of rules or owning numerous books and miniatures. The emphasis is on adventure and storytelling.

Anyone can play, Kids, Adults, Teens, and anyone can be the StoryMaster, as long as they can read aloud and have an hour or three to spare.

It also uses the new Maps, to make the game even more exciting!
Monsters, Magic and Mystery.


Really easy to play.
Hours of fun! Ages 7-Adult. Young and Old adventurer
1-5 Players.
Six playable characters
Maps & Story Log Sheets

boardgame.name: OZ: A Fantasy Role-Playing Setting
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.





From publisher blurb:Adventure is just down the Yellow Brick Road… The award-winning author and illustrator of Neverland returns with another beautiful RPG setting book, in OZ: A Fantasy Role-Playing Game.

While many have traveled with Dorothy Gale to the world of OZ, there is so much more to explore! But know this: there is more to the land and its inhabitants than the rumors might suggest. Appearances can be deceiving and like any good metal smith will tell you, the only way to tell a gold bar from a yellow brick is to hit it with a hammer.
So begins Andrew Kolb’s OZ: A Fantasy Role-Playing Game. Unlike its predecessor, Neverland, OZ uses an urban setting pointcrawl instead of a hexcrawl, full of secrets to discover via underground trains and a monorail that loops around all four districts of OZ. With different neighborhoods to explore, factions to join, and questions to ask (what happened to The Slippers, anyway?) players can escape to the Emerald City for hours on end.

boardgame.name: Three Sisters: Rock Garden Expansion
boardgame.description:
The Three Sisters Rock Garden expansion is an additional scorepad that can be used with Three Sisters. The gameplay is simple, each time you draft a die in Three Sisters, you cross off one space matching the die value and whenever you complete a row or column with crossed off spaces, you choose an adjacent bonus that is used on your main sheets. The Rock Garden is a 3"x5" score pad with 50 double-sided pages.

This was available as an add-on during the Motor City Kickstarter campaign.

boardgame.name: Expanded Powers Guide
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:


Adds 100 more powers and abilities.
Adds 25 more weaknesses.
Includes updated character creation methods for all the new powers.

boardgame.name: Home-Field Advantage
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Lair actions, introduced in D&D 5th Edition, give shape to epic battles by introducing new gameplay mechanics which the players will associate with a boss monster for years to come. However, despite the fact that player characters face off against boss monsters at every tier of play, only a small portion of creatures, most of which in the 3rd and 4th tiers of play, were given lair actions. This book provides a collection of over 250 unique sets of lair actions, covering more than 320 of the most iconic D&D creatures, so that you can create thrilling boss battles for every tier of play, and breathe new life into some of your old favorites.

boardgame.name: DISASTER/PEACE
boardgame.description:
User summary:

DISASTER/ PEACE is a Magical Girl game system that gives you the flexibility to tell unique stories, or retell your favorite stories with vague but evocative prompts and a narrative-driven mechanical system. Inspired by Japan’s Magical Girl genre, DISASTER/ PEACE is made to tell stories of fantastic adolescent heroism.

boardgame.name: DragonSpawn: The Game Player's Guidebook
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

DragonSpawn is an RPG in the fantasy genre. That means this game contains mythical creatures like Minotaurs and dragons. There are wizards and warriors, rogues and men of the cloth in this game. Battles are fought, kingdoms are won, and in general, good triumphs over evil.

boardgame.name: Orizuru: a half-formed thing
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Orizuru is a single-player tabletop story game about transforming into a beautiful bird.

You’ll play a character who undertakes some kind of transformational quest to take themselves from who they are now, to becoming something new.

You’ll take a square piece of paper, write on it, fold it and reflect on the result.

boardgame.name: Campaign of Chaos
boardgame.description:
This is a campaign version of Echoes of Chaos.

From the book's overview:

Campaign of Chaos is a collaborative storytelling game about a group of time-travelling Tourists who set out on a disastrous expedition into the past and accidentally alter the future. In the game, the game master (GM) and the players work together to determine what happens, using dice rolls to determine how successful or unsuccessful various actions are. The GM does not roll dice in this game. Please note - like the one-shot game it is based on (Echoes of Chaos) - Campaign of Chaos is a narrative-first game, the goal of these rules is to help guide the story more so than dictate it.

Campaign of Chaos tells the story of the greedy, dangerous, and potentially disastrous actions of the Tourists as they travel back in time to achieve a secret, personal objective. This can be everything from hunting a Tyrannosaurus Rex, to stealing a famous artifact at the time of its creation, to attempting to become part of history by replacing (or killing) a major figure. Every major dramatic action creates an echo that will have drastic consequences on the future, but the Tourists don't care... at least, not yet. This is the story of how these hapless Tourists loot the past and destroy the future: they may achieve their goal, but it will cost them dearly.

Each campaign consists of several trips back in time from The Time Hotel, a mysterious facility that exists out-of-time. Each Tourist has an overarching Dream that they are trying to achieve: to do so, they will each pursue specific Souvenirs in the past. While helping your fellow Tourists, you will dodge Tour Guides, Chrono Cops, and local threats as you obtain as many Souvenirs as you can. These Souvenirs can be used to achieve your Dream, buy upgrades at the Time Hotel, or even see a glimpse of the FuturePresent to determine how much damage they're causing. Each trip gets you closer to the Dream, but can further ruin the FuturePresent... how far will you go to achieve your Dream?

boardgame.name: Inventing Incantations: A How-to Guide for the Modern Spellcaster
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Writing a new spell doesn’t need to be hard with this step by step guide!
Good for spellcasters who prefer the page and those who embrace tech!

Inventing Incantations is a solo, microRPG that helps you find the words for a spell.
boardgame.rpg: Inventing Incantations: A How-to Guide for the Modern Spellcaster

boardgame.name: The Maker's Call
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

The Maker's Call is a single-player tabletop RPG about the creation of new magic! Spend time cataloging the attempts of The Maker as you seek to create a previously unseen type of magic. Play at the pace you want: you can do a session every day, every week, or however often you feel like playing!

boardgame.name: Wandering Dreams
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Wandering Dreams is an adventure RPG zine about exploring a Soulsborne and Lovecraft inspired world full of strange and unique locations, beings, and things that are waiting for discovery by the player. It is designed for solo play and uses custom rules for combat and encounters. Using a deck of standard playing cards and a 6 sided die (d6) the player sets off on a story telling experience into the world of the dream.

During your adventure you can observe, approach, fight, and run from the denizens of this world by your choice. Explore the world using the card pulls and dice for prompts as well as information on what you are dealing with. A journal is highly recommended to track where you have been, what you have seen, and how your character is doing.

boardgame.name: The Spirit of Small Gifts
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Somewhere in the vast multiverse, there is a post office box. It looks like all post office boxes in all parts of every world, and sits on the corner of any--or possibly every--street. Inside are many levels, inhabited by small spirits whose sole tasks are to ensure that the tiny pieces of every metaphorical puzzle arrive where they are needed before someone needs them. You are one of these spirits. Perhaps someday, you will rise to become a deity.

In The Spirit of Small Gifts, as you talk to your friends about the TTRPG games they're playing, you get to be the answer to the question "Is it reasonable that I'd have _____ in my inventory?" A Spirit of Small Gifts drops small, seemingly valueless trinkets in the mail so that the recipient has them in their pockets when they need them.


Up front, the goals of this game are these: To get people talking to their friends about their RPGs, foster some creative problem solving, and give you an excuse to put some letters in the mail. The goal of this game is explicitly not to override, pressure, or force anyone running a game playing along with your fiction.

boardgame.name: Cast Away
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Cast Away is the definitive tabletop survival RPG. Its Diminishing Dice mechanics reflect the ever-worsening condition of survivors in the aftermath of a disaster—without tracking Hit Points or burdensome injury tables. Death is permanent, therefore, we've created a Haunting system that keeps players engaged long after their characters pass away. Cast Away contains a modular set of guidelines and is easily adapted to any setting, environment, or circumstance.

boardgame.name: Dragon Magic
boardgame.description:
"Explore now options and spell selections for the most fearsome monsters in Dungeons and Dragons! Dragon Magic is full of guidance on running dragons, selecting their spells, and using those spell to enhance their combat and roleplay potential.

Chapter 1 provides guidance to inform what spells dragons take, and reviews every type of dragon in the Monster Manual, listing specific spell options and how they can be used, alongside combat tactics and world-building ideas.

Chapter 2 presents six fully-fleshed out dragon NPCs, complete with backgrounds, roleplaying notes, and stat blocks. Each one is ready to be dropped into any D&D setting to serve as memorable friends, allies or villains!"

(Author Summary)

boardgame.name: Battle of Brandywine
boardgame.description:
The Battle of Brandywine is designed to be a low complexity game but also offers enough optional rules to give the game more complexity for the die-hard wargamer.

The game sets up quickly with both sides commanding roughly 30 units each and several leaders per side, you can set up the game and finish the battle in under two hours.

The unique aspect of the game is the turn sequence and the ability to resolve combat without a combat results chart. All combat is resolved by rolling a D6 per unit. Units that move first receive fire first.

The game includes several scenarios and optional rules and advanced rules.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Galaga Wars
Galaga Wars+
boardgame.description:
35TH ANNIVERSARY
Fire up the engines, power up the laser chambers as the iconic space-faring shooter returns for its 35th Anniversary in a shower of laser blasts, breathless barrel-rolls and smoking missiles.

As a GALAGA Fighter you have powerful weapons at your disposal. Blast bees with powerful lasers, give butterflies a run for their money with the mighty rockets, and drop dangerous space mines on the Queen Bee.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Water landing
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Your starship is crashing.

It’s crashing into an uncharted ocean planet on the edge of known space.

It’s OK. This does happen from time to time. As long as you and some of your crew get to the Lifeboats in time, you should be able to eject and crash land somewhere relatively safely.

From there, you should be able to scrounge up enough local resources to survive at least until rescue can come.

You should be fine, as long as the Skip Drive Core doesn’t breach, local wildlife isn’t too hostile, and you find sources of food and water...

boardgame.name: Tome: The Light Edition – The Gold Codex
boardgame.description: Upgrade your Tome collection with 3 new Elements. Includes 6 Basic Wood spells, 6 Basic Insect spells, and 6 Special Gold Spells.

boardgame.name: 2400: Xot
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

It’s been a generation since the ark fell. Long enough to lose knowledge of space flight; more than long enough for this planet to change you. Small settlements dot a strange landscape, desperate for travelers like you to trade resources, share knowledge, and master the exotica of a lost civilization. Adapt to this world, and humanity may survive what those who came before could not.

Xot is a super-slim, self-contained, lo-fi sci-fi RPG about adapting to life in the ruins of a fallen alien civilization, inspired by far-future settings like Numenera and Vaults of Vaarn. It's 3 pages and a cover, fitting on two sides of a letter-sized page, with rules based on the free 24XX SRD. (Check out the free Inner System Blues for a sample.)

Includes tables to randomly generate characters like (like a telepathic salvager with a cat-sized tardigrade), exotica (like an atmospheric annihilator or a xenobiotic injector), settlements (like one known for its fungal servitors, dangerously close to The Crawling Palace), and encounters (like a protean warlord with coppery teeth seeking worthy opponents).

boardgame.name: SuperMark Bygger Hus
boardgame.description:
A card game for children and others, 5 years and up. You're trying to build a play house by drawing cards from the other players, but avoiding the "Ouch, my finger!" cards.

On your turn, you choose to either

a) draw a building card from another player's hand into your own hand. If you draw an "Ouch, my finger!" card, you discard that and your entire hand of building cards to the bottom of the draw pile.

b) play a subgame where you place one of your tool cards face down and say "Tool". All other players will now also place one of their tool cards face down, and then everybody reveals their chosen tool. The active player will draw a building card from the draw pile, if at least one other player has chosen a different tool. Each of the other players will draw a card, if they chose the same tool as the active player.

At the end of your turn you win by having all four different building cards in your hand. Otherwise play passes to the next player.

boardgame.name: 4-in-1 Dice Games
boardgame.description:
4 dice games in 1 box.
- Play & Repeat
The aim of the game is to earn as much possible money. Money can be earned in 3 different ways: crossing out rows, crossing out colours and crossing out bonus coins.

- Quick & Tactic
You have 3 options during your turn after Rolling the dice: cross out 2 white dice, cross out a combination of 1 white die and 1 coloured dice or pass. The game ends of one player has closed 2 coloured columns.

- Bingo Dice Game
Roll all dice and select 2 of them to cross out on your scoresheet. This game is a little bit like Clever.

- Rainbow Dice Game
Game is like Yatzy, but with coloured dice. The numbers on all dice need to be noted by the right colour.

boardgame.name: Farm Club
當家作豬
boardgame.description:
Farm Club is an optimisation game with simple rules but requiring crucial decisions to be made.

On his turn, each player chooses from the available lots (animal + objective) the one combination that best serves their strategy: should they take a sheep or a duck? Where should they place it on his farm?

With only 9 rounds of play, Farm Club is fast-paced and constantly requires players to use their judgement : each animal, objective or placement will have an impact on the final score and so they should make good use of the 2 special actions allowing them to reorganise their farm or renew the supply of animals and objectives.

After 9 rounds, the player with the highest score wins.

boardgame.name: Extraction
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Despite valiant efforts to destroy the evidence against him, Crime Boss Andrew Oruna, was convicted and sentenced to life imprisonment. With his known organized crime affiliations the authorities decided to have him put aboard a prison ship rather than on a prison planet. Security conditions on prison ships in the Sonora sector are notorious for being harsh as well as nearly escape proof. The travelers are offered a significant sum of money to break him out.

boardgame.name: Unique Items: Collection 04
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Whether found in a shop, as part of a treasure hoard in a dungeon, or simply in a ditch at the side of the road, feel free to add these unique items to your next gaming session. Some are magical, most are mysterious, some are less-than-interesting.

Items include:

A silver necklace with a ruby insert, created by a fertility cult
The Staff of Vipers
Dolly - a rag doll that will protect it's bearer
The Bug Book, containing 3 spells of insect control

boardgame.name: The Void Campaign Setting
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world of The TIngleverse is broad, encompassing all kinds of worlds and a plethora of genres. From romance to comedy, there’s no telling what kind of adventure you’ll find as you trot through Billings, Montana and the mind of Chuck Tingle.

But there’s another side to this world, a place far from Billings where horrific entities screech and moan across the endless cosmic abyss, where creatures conjure death and destruction as they threaten the very fabric of The Tingleverse itself.

I’m speaking, of course, about The Void.

This book is an expansion for your TIngleverse: The Official Chuck Tingle Role-Playing Game, providing all the tools you’ll need to dive into the frightening existential landscape of The Void with your own horror and science fiction campaigns.

Included within are two new playable types that despise The Void, sabertooth and woolly mammoth. You’ll also find a broad assortment of new unique ways, magic items, and voidal monsters to fill out your Tingleverse games in the endless abyss. What’s more, this supplement offers an in depth explanation of the layers of The Void, as well as suggestions for conquered timelines, to provide a setting that will fill you and your closest buds with suffocating cosmic dread!
boardgame.rpg: The Tingleverse: The Official Chuck Tingle Role-Playing Game

boardgame.name: Go Make A Hike: Off the Beaten Path
boardgame.description:
Go Make A Hike: Off the Beaten Path includes three modules that can be added to the base game in any combination.

- Fire & Ice includes 10 new Destinatons with volcanic and snowy themes.
- Ordeals to Adventures adds immediate and ongoing effects that can change the flow of the game.
- Points of Interest adds new, yellow feature cubes that have unique scoring opportunities.

Requires Go Make A Hike to use this expansion.

boardgame.name: Living Object Handbook
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Tingleverse is a mysterious place, packed to the brim with awe-inspiring creatures and things. Of course, sometimes in The Tingleverse creatures and things can be one in the same!

The Tingleverse: Living Object Handbook is an expansion to your Tingleverse: The Official Chuck Tingle Role-Playing Game, designed to bring some of these living objects to life and integrate them into your fantasy world. While the core rulebook explains the guidelines for creating a human, unicorn, bigfoot or dinosaur character, this expansion provides players with 18 additional living objects to choose from when building their Tingleverse avatar.

Listed within are the following new types, each featuring several exclusive cool moves, unique ways and magic items that only living objects can wield:

Gingerbread Them
Haunted Portrait
Living Bicycle
Living Donut
Living Guitar
Living Monetary Unit (Bitcoin/Dollar/Pound)
Living Television
Magic Carpet
Mysterious S Symbol
Physical Manifestation, A Nice Afternoon
Physical Manifestation, The Action Film Genre
Physical Manifestation, This Game
Sentient Coffin
Sentient Detergent Pod
Sentient Die
Sentient Remote Control
Sentient Tree
Tingler

Along with these new player options is slew of other materials to help integrate living objects into your game, including over 20 new monstrous living object-based enemies, as well as invaluable information on what it’s like to eat, age, live, love and fight as a sentient thing in the world of The Tingleverse.
boardgame.rpg: The Tingleverse: The Official Chuck Tingle Role-Playing Game

boardgame.name: Księga Smoków
boardgame.description:
Book of Dragons

Become explorers wandering mysterious lands and discover so far unknown species of dragons.

Your task will be adding them to the magical Book so that other scientists can benefit from your discoveries. Collect dragon cards on the board. They represent an entry in the Book you keep. Each dragon gives you points that decide who of you becomes the best investigator at the and of the adventure.
Good luck!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Księga Smoków

Zostańcie badaczami przemierzającymi tajemnicze krainy i odkrywajcie nieznane do tej pory gatunki smoków.

Waszym zadaniem będzie dopisanie ich do magicznej Księgi, aby inni naukowcy mogli korzystać z dokonanych przez Was odkryć. Zdobywajcie karty smoków leżących na planszy. Reprezentują one wpis do prowadzonej przez Was Księgi. Każdy smok daje Wam punkty, które pod koniec przygody decydują, kto z Was został najlepszym badaczem.
Powodzenia!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Tingleverse: Monster Guide
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This monster guide was designed to bring detail and depth to your Tingleverse game with the addition of 101 new creatures that vary greatly, each with their own unique set of traits, motivations and challenges.

Featuring beasts from the depths of the endless cosmic void, like the abyssaloom (a massive, planet-like entity that bends the minds of all who gaze upon it), or voidal clowns (warped jesters driven mad after an eternity in the overwhelming darkness of The Void). Even entities as powerful as The Cosmic One make an appearance (a superhero alien who crash-landed as a child in Kansas on some timelines, but ended up raised in The Void and turning to a path of doom and destruction in The Tingleverse).

Also collected within are several monsters of American folklore, like hodags, hoop snakes, mothmen, blue oxen, sinkhole sammies and lovelanders.

Even strange entitles from distant timelines of reality can be found within this fiendish tome, strange and bizarre beasts like leecheetahs, moneybees, and slamwiches.

One thing’s for sure, you’ll have no problem embarking on the adventure of a lifetime with these foes and friends waiting for you in The Tingleverse!
boardgame.rpg: The Tingleverse: The Official Chuck Tingle Role-Playing Game

boardgame.name: もやっと海図 (Moyatto Kaizu)
boardgame.description:
もやっと海図 (Moyatto Kaizu) is an exploration game from Japan. The game title means something like 'hazy sea charts'. Players are building up a nautical chart from memory of their voyages, complete with sea monsters. But they aren't quite sure what goes where, and work together to remember what they saw.

In the game, players place tiles showing land and sea. As they place a tile, they can add player pieces, or a pawn worth 2 pieces. If a tile gets to four pieces, it is confident enough to stay. But if it has fewer than four, then some black balls are added to make it up to four.

When a continent is completed, it is scored. Players with the most pieces/pawns get the most points (counting all the pieces on the island), for having been most confident in their memory of the voyage. The next most gets the points of the majority pieces, and so on down. There are bonus points for places of interest on the land (buried treasure) and for adjacent sea monsters.

But the black balls are collected by the majority scorer, and count as negative at the end of the game, along with any player pieces remaining in hand.

The game ends when ten black balls have been used.

The game is a mix of co-operating, and bluffing to complete island with the most confidence.
user summary

boardgame.name: Mandale Fruta
boardgame.description:
There is a great demand for fruit bags!
To earn points you have to fill the bags with as much weight as possible.
To achieve this goal you can mix the content and even add some stone.
It is a game where you can be honest or deceive others at the risk of being found out.

Each player has different fruit cards in his hand. These fruits have a weight from 1 to 10, there are also stones that weigh 11.
In the first phase, all players secretly use their fruit cards at the same time to fill the different bags on the table with the greatest possible weight.
In the second phase, using rings, all players can distrust the fruits that other players have placed.
In the third phase, the cards are revealed and it is defined who takes the bag according to what they put.

The bags add points at the end of the game. The more bags of the same type, the more points that player will get.

—description from the publisher
